Situation1: They join in when the family talks about possible weekend plans.
Expectation2: Attend weekly church services to worship and participate in community activities
Situation2: They think about joining Sunday worship when time allows
Story: As I sat at the dinner table, my family’s voices buzzed with excitement about our weekend plans. My younger sister wanted to go hiking, my parents suggested a family brunch, and everyone looked at me, expecting me to join in. I knew how much these moments meant to them—being present, sharing laughter, and making memories together. But as they talked, my mind drifted to Sunday morning, when I usually attended church. Worship and fellowship were important to me, not just as a routine, but as a way to grow in faith and serve my community. I felt the weight of both expectations pressing on me: my family’s hope for togetherness and my own commitment to my faith. My heart tugged in two directions, and I wondered how I could honor both without letting anyone down.
